image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Hezbollah, Israel exchange fire, testing fragile truce
item.description: Hezbollah fired towards Israeli-controlled territory, prompting Israeli airstrikes in Lebanon. Both sides accused each other of breaching the cease-fire. The Israeli military targeted numerous sites in Lebanon, resulting in 10 fatalities. The cease-fire, mediated by the US and France, ended over a year of conflict. Israeli leaders emphasized strong retaliation to maintain deterrence and enforce the peace agreement.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan anti-terrorism court sends Imran on 14-day judicial remand in 7 new cases
Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy reveal DOGE's expiry date. When is it?
item.description: The new Department of Government Efficiency, led by Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy under President-elect Donald Trump, aims to cut wasteful spending and regulations by 2026. Received support includes Bernie Sanders highlighting the Pentagon's budget issues. DOGE plans to disband after achieving its goals.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Aliya Fakhri was trying to get back with ex after split: Jacobs' mother
French government faces ouster after oppn says it will back no-confidence vote
Elton John, 77, says he has lost his eyesight
Trump’s defence secretary pick Pete Hegseth faces fresh allegations of alcohol abuse, misconduct: Report
item.description: Pete Hegseth, Trump's pick for defence secretary, faces allegations of alcohol abuse, sexual misconduct, and mismanagement during his tenure at veterans' nonprofits CVA and VFF. A 2015 whistleblower complaint cites behavior such as intoxication and inappropriate conduct. Hegseth's attorney dismisses the claims as jealous fabrications.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Cinderella effect and manosphere: New York Times cites traditional gender roles for Trump’s victory
item.description: Donald Trump's victory over Kamala Harris in the 2024 US presidential election is attributed to his appeal to young men frustrated by women surpassing them in education and employment. This shift has driven many men to the 'manosphere,' creating tension and influencing voting behavior.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Former Congressional staffer arrested for ammunition possession at the Capitol
item.description: Michael Hopkins, ex-communications director for Representative Joe Morelle, was arrested for attempting to bring ammunition, including a high-capacity magazine, into the Cannon House Office Building. Following the arrest, Morelle's office terminated Hopkins' employment, underscoring enhanced scrutiny and tightened security protocols at the Capitol.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ex-Kansas detective Roger Golubski dies by suicide ahead of trial for sexual assault
item.description: Former Kansas detective Roger Golubski, accused of decades-long abuse and civil rights violations against Black women, was found dead at his home. His death, ruled a suicide, occurred just before his trial. Despite the serious allegations and community outrage, his passing leaves many feeling justice was not served.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US: South Carolina woman pleads guilty in fatal DUI crash that killed bride
item.description: Jamie Lee Komoroski, a 26-year-old from South Carolina, pleaded guilty to multiple charges in connection with a deadly drunken driving crash that killed a bride and seriously injured the groom just hours after their wedding. The crash occurred in Folly Beach in April 2023. Komoroski faces up to 25 years in prison, with sentencing expected soon.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'All hell to pay': Trump's ultimatum to Hamas to release hostages before 20 Jan
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump demands the release of hostages held by Hamas in Gaza before his January 2025 inauguration, warning of severe consequences. Over 100 hostages remain in captivity from the October 2023 Hamas attacks. Israeli officials express gratitude, but negotiations remain tense as Hamas links release to an end of Israeli military operations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When drunk Pete Hegseth shouted 'kill all Muslims' at a bar on official tour
item.description: New Yorker cited a previously undisclosed whistleblower report on Hegseth's tenure as the president of Concerned Veterans for America that said Hegseth was found intoxicated while acting in his official capacity and sometimes he needed to be carried out of the organization's events. In 2015, at a bar, Hegseth drunkenly chanted 'kill all Muslims" during the early hours.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Jill Biden reacts to Hunter's pardon as President cites 'politicised prosecution'
item.description: First Lady Jill Biden supports President Joe Biden’s decision to pardon Hunter Biden, convicted of federal gun and tax charges. This pardon, covering offenses from 2014 to 2024, follows claims of selective prosecution. While Hunter acknowledged his mistakes during his addiction, the move faced criticism from Republicans, including Donald Trump, who called it an 'abuse of justice'.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Meghan Markle's personal calls rejected by Hollywood power players amid divorce rumors
item.description: Rhere are rumors of Harry and Meghan growing distant as they have already separated their professional ways. According to experts, their popularity solely rests on the public washing of dirty linens of the royal family. Apart from that, they have no sellable content and if Harry and Meghan professionally go two ways, people won't have much interest in either of their lives.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Long Island teen tragically dies during charity hockey game
item.description: Connor Kasin, a 17-year-old Massapequa High School senior, collapsed and passed away during a charity hockey game for Sabrina Navaretta at the Town of Oyster Bay Ice Skating Center, New York. Despite immediate CPR and hospital care, he was pronounced dead. The cause remains unknown, and the community mourns his loss.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who was Omer Maxim Neutra? US- Israeli soldier killed on Oct 7, whose body remains held hostage
item.description: Captain Omer Maxim Neutra, a 21-year-old Israeli soldier, was confirmed dead after being taken hostage by Hamas during their attack on October 7, 2023. Neutra, a tank platoon commander from New York, served in the IDF. Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu assured efforts to return the bodies of all hostages, including Neutra's, for proper burial.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: NYC staffer suspended indefinitely for tearing down Israeli hostage poster
item.description: Nallah Sutherland, an event coordinator for NYC Mayor Eric Adams, has been indefinitely suspended without pay after a video showed her tearing down an Israeli hostage poster and allegedly assaulting an eyewitness. The suspension follows strong criticism from elected officials and Jewish advocacy groups.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Karine Jean-Pierre reacts to 'why did you and Biden lie' about pardon: 'Because of...'
item.description: ​On Monday, Jean-Pierre was asked aboard Air Force One why she persistently lied about the issue to which the press secretary reacted by saying: "The president took an action because of how politically infected these cases were." ​“The system doesn’t get corrupted by politics for people whose name is not Biden?” a reporter asked. “You’re twisting and misrepresenting what I’m saying. I’m talking about a particular issue right now,” Jean-Pierre said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Totally possible’: Joe Rogan reacts to Jamie Foxx and Diddy poisoning rumours
item.description: Joe Rogan and guests discussed the viral rumours about P. Diddy allegedly poisoning Jamie Foxx, leading to Foxx's 2023 hospitalisation. While some eyewitnesses claim Foxx was serious, others believe he may have been joking. A source close to Diddy denied the allegations, amid his ongoing legal issues.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
